data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word بِاللَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: to split/rip, cut the throat, stay, sacrifice, rip open, trench, to slaughter/massacre, slay in large number, that which is sacrificed, victim, slaughtered one.

data.meanings: Slit, ripped, split cut or divided lengthwise. Opening, laying open, widening. Revealing (e.g. story, or an animal's insides). Inquiring to the utmost after sciences or knowledge. Being astonished, amazed, stupefied at seeing something or confounded, confused, perplexed, tired or fatigued, weary or jaded. Ox, bull and cow (bovine genus) both domesticated and wild. A species of grape that is large, black and round and a species of plum in Palestine. Owner or possessor of oxen/bulls/cows. A strong staff/stick (e.g. for driving herds). A sedition, discord or dissention that severs society, corrupts religion and separates men, or something wide spreading/reaching and great. Abundance of wealth/commodities
data.sentence: The word بَقَرَةً comes from the root ب ق ر and is associated with the meanings: Slit, ripped, split cut or divided lengthwise. Opening, laying open, widening. Revealing (e.g. story, or an animal's insides). Inquiring to the utmost after sciences or knowledge. Being astonished, amazed, stupefied at seeing something or confounded, confused, perplexed, tired or fatigued, weary or jaded. Ox, bull and cow (bovine genus) both domesticated and wild. A species of grape that is large, black and round and a species of plum in Palestine. Owner or possessor of oxen/bulls/cows. A strong staff/stick (e.g. for driving herds). A sedition, discord or dissention that severs society, corrupts religion and separates men, or something wide spreading/reaching and great. Abundance of wealth/commodities

data.meanings: to bring down disgrace upon, send down contempt. To mock/ridicule/deride/laugh. (e.g. huzuwan, 2:67) .
data.sentence: The word هُزُوًا comes from the root ه ز ا and is associated with the meanings: to bring down disgrace upon, send down contempt. To mock/ridicule/deride/laugh. (e.g. huzuwan, 2:67) .

data.meanings: to seek or take protection, refuge, be next, the bone (flesh). Ma'aadh - a refuge, Ma'aadh Allaah - I seek refuge with Allaah, God forbid, Allaah be my refuge.. . 'Udhtu (prf. 1st. sing.): I sought refuge/protection.. A'uudhu (imp. 1st. sing.): I seek refuge.. Ya'uudhuuna (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): they seek refuge.. U'iidh (imp. 1st. sing. vb. IV): I seek refuge for, do commend (to your) protection.. Ista'idh (prt. m. sing. vb. 10): seek refuge!. Ma'aadhun (pis. pic.): refuge.
data.sentence: The word أَعُوذُ comes from the root ع و ذ and is associated with the meanings: to seek or take protection, refuge, be next, the bone (flesh). Ma'aadh - a refuge, Ma'aadh Allaah - I seek refuge with Allaah, God forbid, Allaah be my refuge.. . 'Udhtu (prf. 1st. sing.): I sought refuge/protection.. A'uudhu (imp. 1st. sing.): I seek refuge.. Ya'uudhuuna (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): they seek refuge.. U'iidh (imp. 1st. sing. vb. IV): I seek refuge for, do commend (to your) protection.. Ista'idh (prt. m. sing. vb. 10): seek refuge!. Ma'aadhun (pis. pic.): refuge.

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: To be ignorant, not know of a thing, to be silly or foolish, boil vehemently, pretend ignorance, feign ignorance, reckon or esteem someone, cause commotion or unsteadiness, display wrong conduct, to be void of knowledge, believe a thing to be different from what it is in reality, do a thing in a manner different from that in which it ought to be done, proceed without knowledge, to ignore a thing, to be pagan.
data.sentence: The word الْجَاهِلِينَ comes from the root ج ه ل and is associated with the meanings: To be ignorant, not know of a thing, to be silly or foolish, boil vehemently, pretend ignorance, feign ignorance, reckon or esteem someone, cause commotion or unsteadiness, display wrong conduct, to be void of knowledge, believe a thing to be different from what it is in reality, do a thing in a manner different from that in which it ought to be done, proceed without knowledge, to ignore a thing, to be pagan.
